briefdescription.para: The collision layer this component belongs to.
Bitmask specifying layers that generate trigger collisions.

detaileddescription.para: Trigger collision masks may be asymmetric, i.e. a component B must not know about the existence of another layerId.

briefdescription.para: Bitmask specifying layers that generate solid collisions.

detaileddescription.para: Solid collision should be symmetric and in the calling API treated as such: `(maskB & thisLayerId) != 0 && (thisMask & layerBId) != 0`

briefdescription.para: Flag indicating whether this component can report collision events.
Per-behavior layer masks for solid collisions.

detaileddescription.para: Each array index corresponds to a CollisionBehavior enum value. The bitmask at each index indicates which layers trigger that behavior for solid collisions.

briefdescription.para: Per-behavior layer masks for trigger collisions.

detaileddescription.para: Each array index corresponds to a CollisionBehavior enum value. The bitmask at each index indicates which layers trigger that behavior for trigger collisions.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t layerId, bool isCollisionReporter=true, uint32_t solidCollisionMask=0, uint32_t triggerCollisionMask=0)
memberdef.name: CollisionComponent

briefdescription.para: Constructs a CollisionComponent with a layer ID.

parameterdescription.para: The collision layer this entity belongs to.
Whether this entity can emit collision events.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a deep copy of the collision component, preserving layer ID, masks, and all behavior configurations.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether this component can emit collision events.

simplesect.para: True if collision events can be generated, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: Bitmask of layers to generate solid collisions with.

simplesect.para: Reference to this component for method chaining.

parameterdescription.para: Bitmask of layers to generate trigger collisions with.

simplesect.para: Reference to this component for method chaining.
Bitmask of layers this entity generates solid collisions with.
Bitmask of layers this entity generates trigger collisions with.
The layer this entity belongs to.

briefdescription.para: Adds a solid collision behavior for a specific layer.

detaileddescription.para: Associates a collision behavior with a target layer for solid collisions. If a behavior was previously set for the same layer, it is replaced.

parameterdescription.para: The behavior to apply on collision.
The layer ID to associate the behavior with.

simplesect.para: Reference to this component for method chaining.

briefdescription.para: Returns the solid collision behavior for a specific layer.

detaileddescription.para: Looks up the configured behavior for collisions with the specified layer. Returns `CollisionBehavior::None` if no solid collision mask is set for the layer.

simplesect.para: The collision behavior for the specified layer.

briefdescription.para: Returns the trigger collision behavior for a specific layer.

detaileddescription.para: Looks up the configured behavior for trigger collisions with the specified layer. Returns `CollisionBehavior::None` if no trigger collision mask is set for the layer.

simplesect.para: The collision behavior for the specified layer.

briefdescription.para: Adds a trigger collision behavior for a specific layer.

detaileddescription.para: Associates a collision behavior with a target layer for trigger collisions. If a behavior was previously set for the same layer, it is replaced.

parameterdescription.para: The behavior to apply on collision.
The layer ID to associate the behavior with.

simplesect.para: Reference to this component for method chaining.

briefdescription.para: Defines collision layer membership and interaction masks for a GameObject.

detaileddescription.para: CollisionComponent enables layer-based collision filtering by assigning each entity to a specific layer and defining which other layers it can interact with. Two separate bitmasks control trigger (non-physical) or solid (physical) collision generation.
Trigger collisions are asymmetric: entity A can detect entity B without B detecting A. Solid collisions should be treated symmetrically by the collision system.
The collision reporter flag controls whether this entity can emit collision events. Non-reporter entities participate in collision detection but do not generate events.
Example usage: ```cpp constexpr uint32_t LAYER_PLAYER = 1 << 0; constexpr uint32_t LAYER_ENEMY = 1 << 1; constexpr uint32_t LAYER_BULLET = 1 << 2;
